title: If I’m being sued and have no money or assets is it best to file for bankruptcy ?
question: If I’m being sued and can’t afford to pay the amount I’m being sued for is filing for bankruptcy my best and only option?
answers:
Bankruptcy can be the right move for you. Bankruptcy wipes out most debt including underlying debt associated with lawsuits. However, more information is needed to determine if bankruptcy is a good option for you. Who is suing you? How much is the debt for? When were you served the papers?

Feel free to schedule a free consultation with one of the bankruptcy attorneys here.

Whether bankruptcy is your best option can only be determined after having a comprehensive consultation with an experienced bankruptcy attorney.

If you have no assets and your only income is protected (such as social security) and you don't expect any of that to change in the future, and you don't need to rebuild your credit, then you may not need to file a bankruptcy case. However, even in that situation, the relief from creditor collection actions might make it worth filing bankruptcy in any event.

A lot depends on what your goals are and expected future income and assets, as well as the type of debts that you owe.

A consultation with a bankruptcy attorney will enable you to learn about your options and decide what is best for you.
